title: About the Author
text:
About the Author


C.J. Jones






Professional Summary


As a Master’s student in the Data Science and Analytics program at Georgetown University, I am currently building expertise in advanced topics like time series analysis (ARIMA, GARCH, LSTM, and Transformers for time series), deep learning (ANNs, CNNs, RNNs), and database systems (SQL, NoSQL, cloud-based DBMS). This academic experience complements my professional background in financial analysis and data science.


In my previous role as a Senior FP&A Analyst at CharterUP Technologies, I leveraged tools like Python, Alteryx, and SQL to automate workflows, build advanced financial models, and streamline payment processing. These efforts contributed to more accurate forecasting, enhanced reporting, and better operational efficiency. I also worked at Is Inspired, LLC, where I optimized data reporting processes and developed interactive dashboards for project management and financial monitoring.




Experience


Current Position


Graduate Research Assistant at Artificial Intelligence Measurement & Data Science Laboratory


Clean data, develop R/Python scripts, and implement machine learning techniques to interpret international large-scale educational assessments, understand test effectiveness, and uncover patterns in student problem-solving strategies.


Previous Roles


Senior FP&A Analyst (2022 - 2024) at CharterUP Technologies


Employed advanced data analytics tools like Alteryx Designer and Python to optimize financial reporting, forecasting, and payment processing. Engineered automated workflows, built financial models, and designed dashboards to support strategic decision-making and enhance operational efficiency.


Intern Data Analyst (2020 - 2022) at Is Inspired LLC


Automated and optimized data reporting processes, created and migrated data visualizations to dashboards, and developed interactive tools to enhance project management and financial monitoring for clients.




Education



Master of Science in Data Science and Analytics – Georgetown University, Expected 2026


Bachelor of Arts in Economics – The University of Chicago



Skills & Expertise


Core Competencies



Technical Skills: RStudio, JavaScript (MERN Stack), Python (Pandas/TensorFlow), SQL queries, Tableau/BI, Alteryx Designer


Domain Expertise: FP&A, Economics, American Politics



Soft Skills



Communication, teamwork, leadership, project management





Interests



Professional Interests: Natural Language Processing, Neural Networks, Machine Learning in App Development, Database Management


Personal Interests: Skiing, Lacrosse, Chess, Poker, Reading Fantasy & Science Fiction Novels

title: Projects
text:
Highlighted Projects


A showcase of my development work & skill-building initiatives







MERN Social Media Application


Project Link: TakeRater_v1


Description:


Developed a basic social media clone using the JavaScript MERN stack (MongoDB, Express.js, React, Node.js) that enables user sign-up, post creation, editing, deletion, liking, and account following. Features include user authentication, dynamic post feeds, and real-time interactions.


Skills Utilized & Developed:



MERN Stack (MongoDB, Express.js, React, Node.js)


RESTful API design, authentication, and session management


Real-time web functionality & state management


Front-end UI/UX design using React






JavaScript Notes & Tickets Web App


Project Link: CJ Notes


Description:


Programmed a fully functional JavaScript notes and tickets web application with user authentication, CRUD operations, and real-time updates. Utilized the MERN stack, API integration, and state management procedures for a responsive and efficient user experience.


Skills Utilized & Developed:



MERN Stack (MongoDB, Express.js, React, Node.js)


User authentication and secure session handling


Implementing CRUD functionality and database operations


Real-time data updates & React state management






Quarto Website Project


Project Link: CJ’s Portfolio


Description:


This Quarto website project showcases my ability to combine HTML, CSS, and Quarto’s Markdown-based workflows. The site features a custom layout, styled sections, and an organized navigation structure.


Skills Utilized & Developed:



Quarto publishing platform


HTML & CSS custom styling


Markdown and document rendering


Responsive design practices






Gov Tracker Website


Project Link: Gov Tracker


Description:


This project is in development. It will pull executive orders from the Federal Register API, then use ChatGPT to summarize each order. A Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG) pipeline is planned to allow robust querying and cross-referencing of the orders.


Skills Utilized & Developed (Planned):



API integration with Federal Register


Building a ChatGPT-based summarization workflow


Designing a RAG pipeline for interactive queries


Front-end development for user-friendly access to executive orders
